intro: Sida alnifolia var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically pale yellow or white. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
